top.description: Top z-index is for elements which appears on top of all others such as a dropdown leaf or tooltip on a dialog.

overlay.description: Overlay z-index is for overlay components such as dialogs and side sheets.

toast.description: Toast z-index is for messages that appear on top of pages.

floating.description: Floating z-index is for components which have sticky attributes such as floating buttons, headers, navigation bars etc.

high.description: High z-index is for tooltips and dropdowns that appear on top of default level components.

default.description: The default z-index for components and also the elements inside components.

bottom.description: Bottom z-index for is for page or surfaces.

deep.description: Deep z-index is used to stack something behind everything else.

displayXLarge.description: Token will be deprecated. Please use the displayXlarge with lowercase token name.

displayXlarge.description: Largest display text style. Reserved for main titles and headlines and used only once per screen

displayLarge.description: Second largest display text style. Used as section headings or to emphasise key information on a screen (e.g. dashboard statistics)

displayMedium.description: Third largest display text style. Used as section headings or to emphasise important information on a screen (e.g. dashboard statistics)

displaySmall.description: Smalles display text style. Used when an extra level or heading hierarchy is needed (e.g. subsections titles).

displayXsmall.description: Smallest display text style. Used when an extra level or heading hierarchy is needed (e.g. subsections titles).

subtitleXlarge.description: Subtitle style used as larger heading sinside containers

subtitleLarge.description: Subtitle style used as headings inside containers

subtitleMedium.description: Subtitle style used as medium headings inside containers

subtitleSmall.description: Subtitle style used as small headings inside containers

bodyLarge.description: The default paragraph size used for long copy

bodyMedium.description: The secondary paragraph size used in less prominent and short copy

bodySmall.description: The tertiary paragraph size used only in least prominent short copy

caption.description: The text style for small captions and labels

none.description: Border radius value used in sharp base elements

small.description: Border radius value used in smallest children elements

medium.description: Border radius value used in children elements

large.description: Border radius value used in smaller containers

xlarge.description: Border radius value used in mother containers such as cards, dialogs or overlays

xsmall.description: Default border width for surface elements

small.description: Default border width for surface elements

medium.description: Border width for active or focused states of surface elements

large.description: Border width for stong highlights on surface elements

top.description: Top z-index is for elements which appears on top of all others such as a dropdown leaf or tooltip on a dialog.

overlay.description: Overlay z-index is for overlay components such as dialogs and side sheets.

toast.description: Toast z-index is for messages that appear on top of pages.

floating.description: Floating z-index is for components which have sticky attributes such as floating buttons, headers, navigation bars etc.

high.description: High z-index is for tooltips and dropdowns that appear on top of default level components.

default.description: The default z-index for components and also the elements inside components.

bottom.description: Bottom z-index for is for page or surfaces.

deep.description: Deep z-index is used to stack something behind everything else.

xsmall.description: Breakpoint for smallest mobile screens which are less than 374px wide

small.description: Breakpoint for small screens which are between 375px to 767px wide

medium.description: Breakpoint for medium screens which are between 768px to 1023px wide

large.description: Breakpoint for large screens which are between 1024px to 1439px wide

xlarge.description: Breakpoint for extra large screens which are between 1440px to 1919px wide

2xlarge.description: Breakpoint for largest screens which are wider than 1920 px

flat.description: The base color for default page backgrounds and card surface of the light modes

lowest.description: The base color used to slightly seperate a section or element

low.description: The base color used for differentiating a surface from the flat page level

normal.description: The base color used for achieving a strong contrast between the flat page level

high.description: The base color for indicating a state change in the surface such as hovered elements

highest.description: The base color used in the background of elements like a tooltip to make them pop

overlay.description: This color is used for transparent background of overlay components such as dialogs and side sheets

branded.description: Platforms background color for full-screen messages

branded-low.description: Platforms light background color for subtly branded backgrounds

fadeout.description: The gradient color used to communicate a fade out effect

fadein.description: The gradient color used to communicate a fade in effect

low.description: Default elevation for interactive containers

high.description: Elevation for floating elements

default.description: Default focus style for interactive containers

default-inverse.description: Inverse focus style for interactive containers

danger.description: Danger indicating focus style for interactive containers

danger-inverse.description: Danger indicating inverse focus style for interactive containers

secondary.description: Used for displaying less prominent or supportive icons

disabled.description: Used for displaying disabled icons

inverse.description: For icons over opposite-contrast backgrounds, such as over dark backgrounds

inverse-disabled.description: For disabled icons over opposite-contrast backgrounds, such as over dark backgrounds

branded.description: Theme accent color which is used for enabled and selected states of icons

onbranded.description: Used for icons on surfaces using the theme accent color

danger.description: Used for icons which indicate danger or error

ondanger.description: Used for the icons on surfaces which indicate danger or error

success.description: Used for icons which indicate a postive outcome or active status

onsuccess.description: Used for the icons on surfaces which indicate success

info.description: Used for the icons which indicate informative status

oninfo.description: Used for the icons on surfaces which indicate an informative status

warning.description: Used for the icons on surfaces which indicate an informative status

onwarning.description: Used for the icons on surfaces which indicate warning

onneutral.description: Used for the icons on surfaces which indicate a neutral state

enabled.description: This token is a building block and should not be used as standalone. In order to indicate the focused elements, please check the focus tokens under composition tokens group
